intro: Cryptantha torreyana subvar. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and soil stabilization.
